title: Drawing, Project: The elevation of an altar. With alternative suggestions, 1740–1800
title_raw: Project: The elevation of an altar. With alternative suggestions
medium: Pen, ink, bistre; blue gouache colors, white heightening on greyish blue paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Vertical rectangle. The designs are different in the left and right halves. The mensa is supported by scrolls. Plain moldings form the oblong retable frame. An escutcheon crowned by a cross rises on top in front of a shell at left of an architectural background of a column, at right. A twisted column is shown at left, a volute and a baluster, at right.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Project: The elevation of an altar. With alternative suggestions, 1740–1800. Pen, ink, bistre; blue gouache colors, white heightening on greyish blue paper. 
Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-2498
